sub_title: Diversity, Inclusion, Equity & Belonging consultant @ING ❋ Result-oriented with heart for the job as well as the person ❋ The future is up to us
summary:
-- CAREER CHANGE ALERT for recruiters: As I am looking to change my career towards the Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging field, no use anymore to contact me over Agile Coaching or Scrum Master related functions. Do reach out if you'd like to discuss an opportunity in the DEIB field, of course! -- 

♦   My keywords: consultant | trainer | coach | DEI&B (diversity, equity, inclusion & belonging) | LGBTIQ+ | accessibility | event organizer | communication | networking | facilitating | result-oriented | execution power | Systemic Transition Management (S-TM) | Agile | Lean Six Sigma Green Belt | Output Management | visualization | social media | LinkedIn | 15+ years of business English | 10+ years experience in working with (inter)nationally distributed/remote team members   

♦   ‘Everybody belongs’ has been a main theme in my life since I was very young. In my professional career, I have been active for many years next to my regular work, organizing events building knowledge and mutual understanding. Since 2019, I am a board member of Rainbow Lions NL, ING's employee network for LGBTI+ colleagues and their allies. Also see the articles attached to my profile to learn more about me and my inner drives. 

♦   To support people to do it themselves, that is my inner drive, either 1:1 or in a group or team. To get them where they need to be, I use ‘feedforward’ (⇔feedback), openness and humor. I always look for what already is present ‘within’ and start from there. This way I establish genuine, warm relationships and I am able to bring to the surface what was there all along.

♦  I am a motivating and strong personality with an eye for the other. Other words describing me: self-starting, result-oriented, execution power, good with words.  

Contact details: 
SvanScheppingen@outlook.com

treasury_media.title: Rainbow Lions | Everyone should be able to be themselves at work
treasury_media.description:
Within ING, the Rainbow Lions networks are aimed at helping to create a work environment in which everyone can be themselves. In this interview Ibrahim Cirak and Sandra van Scheppingen, both board members of ING Rainbow Lions, share why this is so important and how they contribute to this goal.
For the Dutch version of this interview: https://www.ing.jobs/nederland/over-ing/diversiteit/verhalen/artikel/rainbow-lions-4.htm

treasury_media.title: Your whole self: Sandra | When it all gets too much.
treasury_media.description: "Sandra van Scheppingen is an Agile coach at COO/Global Know Your Customer. A few years ago, her mother was diagnosed with Parkinson’s disease and gradually required more of Sandra’s care. In 2020, it all became too much for her. Read on about the steps she took to regain her mental strength."

treasury_media.title: "All about me" visual ;o)
treasury_media.description:
I made this visual during the 'I can draw' workshop in January 2016, the assignment being to define yourself by drawing notable aspects of your life. For instance I looove a cup of Twinings Lady Grey tea, so should we ever meet up...
It was my first visual ever and I discovered it is actually not that hard to do and much fun on top of that!

education.field_of_study: Integral Agility for Coaches - From awareness to embodiment

awards.title: Finalist Workplace Pride Leadership Awards - Most Effective Ally
awards.description:
This award honors the most effective ally of the past year, both within their own organization and externally, helping to make progress with LGBTIQ+ inclusion in the workplace.

From Workplace Pride’s finalists jury report:
“Sandra is a powerful ally to the LGBTIQ+ community, both in and outside of ING. She tells the story, so that everyone in our organization can learn from it. Sandra organized ING participation in the Prides of Leeuwarden and Amsterdam, has helped to uplift people with HIV and always takes an intersectional approach. She pro-actively volunteers with ING Rainbow Lions and has moderated Reverse Mentoring workshops with managers on how to create an LGBTIQ+ empowering workspace.”

From ING’s nomination report:
"Sandra’s strength is getting out the message on social media. She told the history of Rainbow Lions on the ING intranet and facilitated LGBTQ+ bias workshops. Through her frequent posts on internal and external social media she has become a role model for allies. She has been on the board four 5 years now. She is a is a mobilizer who inspires people to take action. She proactively volunteered with ING Rainbow Lions to moderate reverse mentoring workshops with managers to educate them on how to create an LGBTIQ+ empowering workspace. She organized ING participation in Pride Leeuwarden, and Amsterdam. Sandra makes connections, takes an intersectional approach, initiating cross-network collaboration resulting a.o. in an ING D&I Week 2022 event."
awards.issuer: Workplace Pride - The platform for LGBTIQ+ inclusion at work

awards.title: Award for Resume of the Month October 2015
awards.description:
October 2015, I won the Resume of the Month election organized by SollicitatieLAB*), a training and coaching company in career development and outplacement (www.sollicitatielab.nl). Received feedback, among other:
♦ "The layout is well-arranged and provides the right info. A lady who has achieved something."
♦ "Sandra is a warm and professional personality, you cannot really catch that on paper, but it does have to be mentioned."
♦ "The cv of sandra shows very well who sandra exactly is. Her competences and enthusiasm sparkle from  the paper. This cv is making me very happy."

All feedback and the jury report (in Dutch) can be found over here:
♦ http://sollicitatielab.nl/de-60-beste-cv-s-jaar/cv-sandra-1/
♦ http://www.sollicitatielab.nl/de-60-beste-cv-s-jaar/cv-de-maand-oktober/

*) This company has been organizing this monthly election - culminating into the overall resume of the year election - for several years now. A changing panel of professional recruiters values all five nominated resumes and provides feedback. Together with the public vote this determines who will receive the accolade of 'Resume of the Month'.

profile_positions.description:
A short term assignment (4 months) with a focus on Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging within the Bank Mendes Gans (BMG) organization, a Dutch bank specializing in international cash management services. BMG is an independently operated subsidiary of the ING Group (as part of Wholesale Banking).
Activities: translating INGs recently updated Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging strategy towards the BMG organization:
♦ Short and long term Plan of Approach accelerating D&I activities.
♦ Data analysis and dashboard on dimensions gender, age and nationality to help determine priorities.
♦ Facilitating and planning Team Dialogue sessions.
♦ Allyship support page with tools and resources.
profile_positions.title: Assignment with a focus on Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging

profile_positions.description:
Short term assignment in ING’s global Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging team:
♦ Coordinating the Workplace Pride Global Benchmark process for 20 ING countries/regions, aggregating and describing evidence, advising on process improvements to ensure a sustainable future in benchmark participation.
Result: score for 2023 improved significantly compared to 2022 (embargo on publication of exact results until Q4/23).
♦ Advising on the set up of 'ally collaboration' between ExCo members, local country sponsors and Employee Networks.

Courses:
♦ March 2023: course Diversity & Inclusion (University of Leiden)
profile_positions.title: Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging Consultant @ ING Global HR

profile_positions.description:
Next to my regular job, I am always active supporting employee network's activities, as well as the Global Head of Accessibility within ING. Below some examples of this year's events/activities.
♦ Organizing an intersectional children's books reading event observing both IDPD (International Day for People with Disabilities) on Dec 3, and Purple Friday, on Dec 9. This event was aimed at (grand/bonus/etc.) children of ING employees, involving a panel, the reading of several inclusive children's books, face painting and lots of pancakes. Special guests: Floris Dorgelo, author of Storkie: A Diverse Delivery, Willemijn Kloosterman, author of De Fantastische Slurf, and Dolly Bellefleur as interviewer and hostess.
♦ Supporting the Global Head Accessibility with improving the visual imaging of people with a disability within ING. Organizing a soundboard session with matter experienced ING colleagues, defining what a photo would have to look like in order for it to well-represent people with a disability. Also, improving the keywords to be used to find applicable visual materials. Facilitating the conversation, streamlining the collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
♦ Coordinating local activities for the Diversity & Inclusion Week for ING in the BeNeLux in October, 2022, in support of the Head of Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging of Belgium/the Netherlands.
♦ Coordinating participants and the choreography for the Canal Pride boat 2022 of ING Rainbow Lions in Amsterdam.
♦ Board member since 2019 of ING’s employee resource group (ERG) Rainbow Lions 🌈, for colleagues identifying as LGBTQ+ and allies. Responsible for event organization, communication (newsletter, Yammer intranet community a.o.)

Courses:
♦ November, 2022 - January, 2023: Voice Dialogue (ICM Opleidingen & Trainingen)
♦ October, 2022 - ongoing: German Conversation B1/B2 > C1 (private lessons via Preply)
♦ September - October, 2022: Professional Advisor (Boertien Vergouwen Overduin)
profile_positions.title: Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging on project basis

profile_positions.description:
Know your customer (KYC) is the first step towards a safe and compliant bank. It ensures we only do business with people and companies we have verified as being trustworthy. This includes carrying out customer due diligence checks, updating customer files, screening customers and transactions, monitoring transactions and reporting suspicious activities.

As an Agile Coach I supported several management and employee teams in an operational environment, learning how to work in an Agile way. I set-up a Management Obeya, initiated the teams in the the Agile way of working via trainings and coaching, supported the Scrum Master to find ways for her team to continuously improve.

As a Global KCY Party Squad member I organized several events for my department.

Methodologies used, a.o.: Lean, Kanban, Obeya, Systemic Transition Management (S-TM), Output Management.

Provided trainings: 
♦ Workshop Agile Essentials to onboard new employees
♦ Workshop Refinement 

Courses:
♦ June, 2021: ACAMS Anti-Money Laundering Foundations - Certificate of Achievement
♦ December, 2021: ACAMS Know Your Customer Foundations - Certificate of Achievement
♦ January, 2022: ACAMS Sanctions Foundations - Certificate of Achievement
profile_positions.title: Senior Agile Coach & Trainer @ Global Know Your Customer

profile_positions.description:
As Agile Coach I was part of the Center of Expertise Agile Coaching Client Services within ING Domestic Banking. In this period, I supported 9 Customer Loyalty Teams as well as their Leads within the operational mortgage department of ING Domestic Bank (HypING). 

In this area, each team has approx. 10 members; so called CLT members. They are responsible for excellent, personal and careless service to customers in the area of mortgage maintenance. Teams are working self-organised and are responsible for the end-to-end process of mortgage maintenance, as well as 1st line call support. As of March, 2020 (start of the COVID-19 home quarantine period) until the end of my assignment here, we all worked from home as a distributed team.

ING HypING uses the LEAN methodology to identify and implement improvements in the application processes. Members are challenged to assess the way they are working, as well as their (cross) team cooperation and results, in order to improve continuously.
Methodologies used, a.o.: Lean, Kanban, Obeya, Systemic Transition Management (S-TM), Output Management.

Provided trainings: 
♦ Workshop Facilitating Remote Retrospectives
♦ Onboarding training for new HypING members, about ING's Agile Way of Working
♦ Internationale Agile in Service training voor managers binnen het Client Services domein

In 2019-20, I was also part of the project team setting up the Agile Academy for the Client Services organisation within ING Domestic Banking.
profile_positions.title: Agile Coach & Trainer @HypING In Life Management

profile_positions.description:
As Agile Coach I am part of the Center of Expertise Agile Coaching Client Services within ING Domestic Banking. In April 2019, I returned to ING again as an internal employee.

During this timeframe, I supported 9 Customer Loyalty Teams as well as two Leads within the operational mortgage department of ING Domestic Bank (HypING). Each team has approx. 10 members; so called CLT members. They were responsible for excellent, personal and careless service to customers in the area of mortgage requests. Teams are working self-organised and are responsible for the end-to-end process of mortgage requests of intermediaries, as well as 1st line call support.

ING HypING uses the LEAN methodology to identify and implement improvements in the application processes. Members are challenged to assess the way they are working, as well as their (cross) team cooperation and results, in order to improve continuously.

Together with a colleague I developed the training Facilitating Agile Events for members to learn about and practice interpersonal behaviour and communication patterns (Leary's Rose), including a train the trainer and a training scenario.
Next to that, I am also part of the project team setting up the Agile Academy for the Client Services organisation within ING Domestic Banking.
profile_positions.title: Agile Coach and Trainer @HypING Originations

profile_positions.description:
As Agile Coach I support 9 Customer Loyalty Teams as well as two Leads within the operational mortgage department of ING Domestic Bank (HypING). Each team has approx. 10 members; so called CLT members. They are responsible for excellent, personal and careless service to customers in the area of mortgage requests and maintenance. Teams are working self-organised and are responsible for the end-to-end process of mortgage requests of intermediaries, as well as 1st line call support.

ING HypING uses the LEAN methodology to identify and implement improvements in the application processes. Members are challenged to assess the way they are working, as well as their (cross) team cooperation and results, in order to improve continuously.

Results:
♦	Leads got more focus and drive on the key focus areas for their circle (department); prioritising the actions, using data, a Kanban board and weekly meetings to (re)assess work, progress and priorities.
♦	Facilitated many retrospectives, planning and evaluation sessions.
♦	Facilitated the team members to define a plan agreeing how to cater for work during quiet, busier and ultra hectic times.
♦	1:1 coaching of team members on several areas (mindset and behaviour, career planning, wellbeing).
♦	Revived retrospectives, team boards.
♦	Taught the teams to maintain focus on continuously improving, also in ultra hectic times; change may also come in very small steps. Resulted in teams defining, trying and implementing new ways of working together, teams exchanging best practices, teams helping each other to cater for work.
♦	Participated many times in the HypING Experience, informing (inter)national ING colleagues about the Agile way of working within the operational environment of HypING.
♦	Participated in ING's Agile Tour for external companies, answering questions around the topic of Agile coaching and what the Agile way of working involves.
♦	Facilitated several Agile blocks for INGs on boarding program for new employees.
profile_positions.title: Agile Coach @HypING Aanvraag via Wemanity

profile_positions.description:
As an Agile Coach, I support companies willing to make the transformation from a more traditional way of working towards the Agile way. What this ‘Agile way’ actually involves, depends on what the company and its departments need. 

Starting an assignment, I enjoy talking to people and to act as fly on the wall to analyze what currently is holding teams and individuals back from performing optimally. In the end, a lot evolves around interaction and mindset, both strong pillars within the Agile way of working.
Subsequently, I will advise about the best Agile approaches to facilitate the Agile transformation within a company and I will support teams and individuals in their personal and professional growth. In this process, I use DSDM, Scrum and Lean methodologies among other.

Wemanity offers a broad scale of possibilities to shape and facilitate the Agile transformation of a company, from assessment to implementation. We have a broad international team specializing in many Agile methodologies. Do contact me to hear more about our approach.

Besides my regular activities, I currently am co-facilitating the team page of all Wemanity colleagues on our website and I organize meetups with customers and prospects. 
In the past, I was responsible for Wemanity's group Twitter account in 2016 – 2017 and I took part in the Social Media team. 

Other activities: 
Q3/16: translation of the book "The illustrated guide of Agile best practices" from French to English, as well as translating parts of the Wemanity website from English to Dutch. 
Dec '17: Inspirational Agile Breakfast for customers in The Hague, where Arie van Bennekum, co-author of the Agile Manifesto, shared his insights and knowledge. 
Jan '18: I created the Dutch subtitles to Henrik Kniberg's reknown video 'Agile Product Ownership in a Nutshell': https://amara.org/en/videos/ymgYyCpSVr60/en/471078/.
Feb '18: Live-streaming event in The Hague of the Agile Consortium's annual conference in Brussels.
profile_positions.title: Agile Coach & Trainer

profile_positions.description:
I supported Canon’s Digital IT Web Presence team, working distributed with remote team members in Amstelveen (NL), Mumbai (India) and London (UK). The team's scope for development and maintenance are the Canon Europe websites (±60 in ±30 languages) within the EMEA region. The content of the website is managed in CMS application SDL Tridion.

I supported the team to improve their Agile way of working. I coached the Product Owner, Scrum Master, team's manager, business stakeholders and the team in general.
I acted as a linking pin between the team and the external supplier for the B2B project, in which my team developed/implemented new templates according to design. I ensured the continuous alignment of the teams' work and their delivery moments, helped solving impediments and facilitated design review sessions.

Used Agile methodologies: DSDM, Scrum, Kanban.
Used tooling: Trello, Skype, SharePoint, Excel, Jira, Confluence.

Results:
♦	Implementation of Agile rituals as Refinement, Retrospective, Review sessions
♦	Set up of Information Radiators in the team space (Kanban, Burndown, DoD, Team Values, etc.)
♦	Supported the team in defining their DoR, DoD, Team Values, Team Skills & Ambition chart.
♦	Preparation/facilitation of Planning, Retrospective, Review and Refinement sessions.
♦	Taught the team about discipline, team dynamics, the value of the Law of Two Feet, how to keep meetings within the time box, what Scrum poker is really about, about the team’s responsibility to getting the work to Done, etc.
♦	Workshops Product Backlog management, User Stories and Visualization of information.

♦	Implemented Agile reporting to a waterfall management, using Excel for generating Burndown, Capacity Forecasting, Velocity and Defects charts.
♦	Implemented a Flow to Ready procedure.
♦	Migration of the team’s Product Backlog and documentation from Trello to Jira/Confluence.
♦	Set up of the Confluence Team Space (Team Foundations/ Information/ Work).
profile_positions.title: Agile Coach & Project Manager via Wemanity

profile_positions.description: Working with cegeka-dsa I had the chance to support the Consultants, Support and Back office teams in their agile transformation. Assessments, trainings and coaching of management, teams and individuals are all in the game. Main emphasis on DSDM, Scrum and Kanban methodologies.
profile_positions.title: Agile Coach &Trainer via Agile in the Core/Cegeka

profile_positions.description:
As an Agile Coach & Trainer I helped Cegeka's customer's teams develop their Agile skills in order to rapidly become self-sufficient and benefit from Agile approaches. 
More specifically, the Agile Coach supports the start-up of projects, gives advice to improve the application of Scrum (or other Agile delivery methods) and shares the best practices. The Agile Coach promotes and facilitates the adoption of Agility within teams through team coaching, one-on-one mentoring, delivery of Agile training classes, workshops and briefings.
profile_positions.title: Agile Coach & Trainer @ Agile in the Core

profile_positions.description:
I like being busy and as in-between-jobber there was no difference. JobOn (f.k.a. DeBroekriem) is a platform where in-between-jobbers and starters can meet up, connect and improve their job application skills.

I was active for JobOn as an Event Manager and trainer in the city of Leiden, on a voluntary basis. This because I like to contribute something; networking in the end is all about 'giving wholeheartedly'. And in that sense I wished for my in-between-job companions to get inspired by wonderful and worthwhile events of JobOn. Thus enabling them to move on with new energy and insights!

As Event manager I organized workshops and meetings for in-between-jobbers/starters. To this purpose I contacted professional guest speakers and locations where meetings could take place. An extra challenge in this was that both professionals and locations have to do it for free.

As a Trainer I also committed myself to provide workshops for JobOn members in topics related to employability and job searching.

Trainings provided:
♦	How to tackle those difficult interview job interview questions (evaluation figure 8.0)
♦	The added value of Twitter when looking for a job  (evaluation figure 8.8)
♦	Towards a cv than cannot be overlooked!  (evaluation figure 9.1)
- - - - - - - - - - 
Since 2016 I am invited as guest speaker/trainer by JobOn:
♦	Elevator Pitch - Let yourself be heard! (Feb/'16)
♦	LinkedIn for beginners (Mar/'16)
♦	Stop playing ping-pong; have a real conversation (as side-kick of SollicitatieLab, Sep/'16)
♦	In search for your own Core Quadrant (Oct/'16)
♦	LinkedIn for beginners (Dec/'16)
♦	LinkedIn for beginners (Nov/'17,  evaluation figure 8.8)
♦	In December 2017 DeBroekriem invited me to give LinkedIn 'expert' advice to their members
♦	Agile for Job Hunters (apr/'18, evaluation figure 8.7 and sep/'18, evaluation figure: 8.8)

The video pitch (in Dutch) below was made when I was installed as Event Manager at JobOn.
profile_positions.title: Trainer and Event Manager (voluntary basis)

profile_positions.description:
As a trainer I supported redundant colleagues in their personal journey to define the next step in their career and to find their new challenge.

Trainings offered to support that process are among other:
♦	CV – what are the do’s and don’t’s nowadays?
♦	Social media; LinkedIn and Twitter – How to improve your account, how to use it?
♦	Focus training – to (re)define who you are, what you are capable of and what your goals are.
♦	How to apply for a job, prepare job interviews & everything you need to know about networking

Other activities:
♦ A ten-step starting guide to Twitter (written, composed and edited), which was published on the ING HR intranet site for career development as general self-study material. It also serves as mandatory preparation material for HR Mobility clients subscribing to a Twitter workshop.
♦ Organized/coordinated a 'joblink'​ event in September to introduce HR Mobility clients to the external job market, from brainstorm to execution. Goals: inform, inspire and engage our clients. Martijn Smit of Werken.FM hosted the day, Geert-Jan Waasdorp (Intelligence Group) presented the keynote. The event was supported on intranet and Twitter.

  » Around 20 companies (a.o. Aegon, Eneco, SNS Bank, Randstand Yacht, USG Start) presented their job openings to 250 clients and discussed them in speeddates.
  » The Chamber of Commerce and the Instituut voor Midden- en Kleinbedrijf offered their services to clients interested in starting their own company. 
  » Clients could subscribe to several workshops, ask advice on their resume and LinkedIn profile and have their photo taken. 

  My specific contributions to this event, among other: 
  » brainstorming set-up
  » project coordination; organizing project meetings, stand up meetings to inform and engage our department's colleagues, writing the event's script.
  » supplier coordination
  » communication towards clients (save the date, invitation, reminders, event's programme)
profile_positions.title: Trainer @ ING HR Mobility

profile_positions.description:
During this period a Mobility Coach supported me in defining a new direction in my career.
I followed several trainings and seminars.
profile_positions.title: Reconsidering my career

profile_positions.description:
I like being busy and as in-between-jobber there is no difference. I found DeBroekriem via Twitter; it is a platform where in-between-jobbers and starters can meet up, connect and improve their job application skills. I immediately became very enthusiastic about the accessible and activating nature of this organisation. 

During this period I became active as an Event manager in the region Haarlem, on a voluntary basis. This because I like to contribute something; networking in the end is all about 'giving wholeheartedly'. And in that sense I wish for my in-between-job companions to get inspired by wonderful and worthwhile events of DeBroekriem. Thus enabling them to move on with new energy and insights!

As Event manager I organised workshops and meetings for in-between-jobbers/starters. To this purpose I contacted professional guest speakers and locations where meetings could take place.
profile_positions.title: Trainer and Event Manager (voluntary basis)

profile_positions.description:
Team manager of 3 employees (Product Owners). Responsible for three online banking solutions, the main task related to an internet banking solution for payments & cash management in the CEE region (Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Romania, Russia, Slovak Republic and Ukraine), developed and maintained by a DevOps team distributed over Sofia, Bulgaria and Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 
End-to-end responsibility. Delegated Asset Owner. Define and implement strategy.
Risk, process and stakeholder management. Representing Product Management Channels in the board of a project to implement a centralized legal framework for multiple products in the pan-European ING network. Delegate Executive of a project to simplify customer related operational processes throughout the ING network.

Results:
•	Built a strong and dedicated team
•	Became a confident and empowering manager, able to bring out the best in people.
•	Implemented IRM requirements for Asset Ownership of an internet banking solution, created a dashboard and SharePoint site to centralize access to all evidence.
•	Steered on process improvements, e.g. to decrease lead time of an implementation procedure through a contract database tool, to simplify a regional risk procedure, in close collaboration with a Lean Black Belt. 
•	Set up and maintained an intranetsite for the main internet banking solution on the social platform of ING, based on SharePoint.
profile_positions.title: Manager Product Management | Online Business Banking

profile_positions.description:
End-to-end responsible for an internet banking solution for payments & cash management, present in 8 countries in the Central East of Europe region. Developed and maintained by a DevOps team , distributed over Sofia (BG) and Amsterdam (NL). Strategy and MTP definition, change management, risk management, international stakeholder management, operational process management, maintaining internal and external communication materials, incident management.

Results:
•	Built the internal organization of the internet banking solution; cooperating with international colleagues e.g. by improving communication, procedures, and building cross border team spirit. 
•	Implemented a portal page (2008) offering single sign on access to all instances of the internet banking solution 
•	Implemented  the Russian local instance (2010), incl. COPAF deliverables as process descriptions and process trainings throughout the CEE region, NL and BE.
•	Implemented Information Risk Management (IRM) requirements. Acted as delegate Asset Owner. Maintained and issued a monthly control report to the asset owner.
•	Defined and implemented process improvements, e.g. signing in counterpart, acting on scanned contracts, user/account termination via letter instead of contract.
•	Organized an international internal user conference (day and evening programme) with participants from 9 countries.
profile_positions.title: Senior Product Manager E-banking (Central East of Europe)

profile_positions.description:
End to end responsible for an internet banking solution for documentary payments in Belgium and The Netherlands.

Result: 
•	Market introduction of two modules for Export Letter of Credit and Documentary Collections.
•	Demos to Sales and Support departments.
•	Development and implementation of communication materials, such as brochures, support instructions and manuals.
profile_positions.title: Channel Manager E-banking (Belgium & The Netherlands)

profile_positions.description:
Project member responsible for developing and implementing a migration strategy to transfer Wholesale Banking customers to a new online banking channel. The project was ended prematurely.

Results: 
•	Migration strategy,
•	Marketing communication plan.
profile_positions.title: Channel Manager E-Banking (European E-Banking channels)

volunteer_experiences.role: Bestuurslid/Board member Rainbow Lions NL (LGBTI+ network for ING employees)
volunteer_experiences.description:
(English below)
Mogen zijn wie je bent, houden van wie je wilt en dat zorgeloos kunnen uitdragen, het klinkt zo simpel en logisch, maar dat is het helaas nog niet. Daarom is het goed dat er binnen ING ook een netwerk actief is voor LHBTI+-collega’s en hun bondgenoten. Ik ben gevraagd om die bondgenoten een gezicht te geven binnen het bestuur en daar heb ik met plezier ja op gezegd. Samen werken we o.a. aan meer bewustwording van de uitdagingen op de werkvloer voor LHBTI+-collega’s, aan het blootleggen van onbewuste vooroordelen en het organiseren van mooie bijeenkomsten voor alle leden van ons netwerk.

To be who you want to be, to love whom you want to love and to be able to share that without any doubt. It sounds so simple and obvious, but unfortunately it still is not. It is a good thing therefore that there is an active network within ING for LGBTI+-colleagues and their allies. I was invited to represent these allies within the current Gala board, to which I gladly said yes. Together, we a.o. raise awareness of the challenges faced at work for LGBTI+-colleagues, help uncover unconscious bias and organize interesting events for all network members.

(English below)
Samen met het activiteitenteam organiseer ik verschillende activiteiten door het jaar heen, gericht op kinderen die in en rond Nieuw-Vennep wonen.

Together with the Activities team, I organize activities several times a year aimed at children living in and around Nieuw-Vennep.

volunteer_experiences.role: Lid van de Oudercommissie / Member of the Parent Advisory Committee

company.name: De Boogies Buitenschoolse Opvang / After-School Care

volunteer_experiences.description:
(English below)
Als lid van de Oudercommissie vertegenwoordig ik alle ouders wiens kinderen gebruik maken van de opvang van Boogies Wonderland. Ik geef in vergaderingen gevraagd en ongevraagd advies over de adviesonderwerpen die in de Wet kinderopvang zijn vastgelegd.

As a member of the Parent Advisory Committee, I represent all parents whose kids are under the care of Boogies Wonderland. I give solicited and unsolicited advice in meetings about advisory subjects as established by the Dutch law for professional child care.

(English below)
DeBroekriem is een platform voor en door werkzoekenden, waar je elkaar kunt ontmoeten en waar je je sollicitatievaardigheden kunt verbeteren. Ik heb heel enthousiast over het laagdrempelige, verbindende én activerende karakter van deze organisatie.
Als onbezoldigd Trainer verzorg ik loopbaangerichte workshops voor DeBroekriem-leden.
Verzorgde trainingen:
♦	Op zoek naar je eigen Kernkwadrant!
♦	Solliciteren - Vergroot je kansen op een goed gesprek! (evaluatiecijfer: 8,0)
♦	Twitter, een goed idee als je werk zoekt! (evaluatiecijfer: 8,8)
♦	Op naar een cv waar je niet omheen kunt! (evaluatiecijfer: 9,1)
♦	Elevator Pitch - Laat van je horen! (als gastspreker in Breda in februari 2016)
♦	LinkedIn voor beginners (als gastspreker in Den Haag in maart 2016)
♦	Stop met pingpongen en ga in gesprek (als side-kick van SollicitatieLab in Leiden in september 2016)
♦	Op zoek naar je eigen Kernkwadrant (als gastspreker in Leiden in oktober 2016)
♦	LinkedIn voor beginners (als gastspreker in Leiden in december 2016)
♦	LinkedIn voor beginners (als gastspreker in Den Haag in november 2017, evaluatiecijfer: 8,8).
♦	In december 2017 nodigde DeBroekriem mij uit om als 'expert van de maand' LinkedIn-adviezen te geven aan de leden.
♦	Agile voor Werkzoekenden (als gastspreker in Amsterdam, apr/'18, evaluatiecijfer: 8,7 en Hilversum, sep/'18, evaluatiecijfer: 8,8).

DeBroekriem is a platform where in-between-jobbers and starters can meet up, connect and improve their job application skills. I am very enthusiastic about the accessible and activating nature of this organisation. 

As a trainer I provide employability related trainings on a voluntary basis, e.g. around LinkedIn or Twitter, resume writing, elevator pitch, Core Quadrants, as well as Agile for Job Hunters.

(English below)
Verschillende activiteiten door de jaren heen voor en met verstandelijk beperkte cliënten. Van het helpen met activiteiten in de avond of op zondagmorgen, het ondersteunen van de maandelijkse disco en de jaarlijkse Oudejaarsavondviering tot het mee uit nemen van een oudere cliënt (bioscoopbezoek, lunch, etc.)

Activities varied throughout the years, from helping out with evening or Sunday morning activities, supporting the monthly disco and yearly Sylvester celebration for mentally disabled people, to being a one-on-one volunteer accompanying an elderly client (going to the cinema, having lunch together, etc.)

volunteer_experiences.role: Lid van de denktank / member of the thinktank
volunteer_experiences.description:
(English below)
Dream2Work is een loopbaanorganisatie voor en door jongeren. Jongeren bedenken zelf wat ze nodig hebben om verder te komen in hun loopbaan. Door meer ervaring maken jongeren betere keuzes en vergroten hun kansen. 

Ik was actief in de denktank van de organisatie. Mijn primaire aandachtsgebied was het netwerken. Ik ondersteunde de betrokken jongeren bij het invullen van dit onderdeel. Ik bekeek waar nodig verbeterpunten op de presentaties, trainingen en interne handleidingen die ze opleveren. 
http://dream2work.com/


Dream2Work is an employability organization for adolescents, organized by adolescents. They determine themselves what they need to progress in their careers. Dream2Work offers them a platform to get more experience in e.g. training other adolescents. The experience enables them to make better choices and enlarges their employability opportunities.

I was active in the organization’s thinktank. My primary scope was ‘networking’. I supported the involved adolescents in finding their way in this subject. I reviewed their presentations, trainings and internal manuals and provided feedback.
http://dream2work.com/
